items.q: Which of these European countries is a landlocked nation?
items.explanation: Switzerland is completely enclosed by France, Germany, Austria, Liechtenstein, and Italy.

items.q: The Tropic of Capricorn lies north of the Equator.
items.explanation: The Tropic of Capricorn is south of the Equator; the Tropic of Cancer is north.

items.q: Antarctica is technically classified as a desert.
items.explanation: A desert is defined by its low annual precipitation, not its temperature. Antarctica is incredibly dry.

items.q: What is the most populous city in the United Arab Emirates (UAE)?
items.explanation: It is famous for luxury shopping, modern architecture like the Burj Khalifa, and a lively nightlife scene.

items.q: What geographical line designated at 0 degrees longitude runs through Greenwich, England?
items.explanation: It bisects the eastern and western hemispheres.

items.q: Which river runs through the Grand Canyon?
items.explanation: The river and its tributaries carved the dramatic geological features of the canyon over millions of years.

items.q: Name the immense coral reef located off the coast of Queensland, Australia.
items.explanation: It is the world's largest coral reef system, visible even from outer space.

items.a: A strait is a naturally formed, narrow, typically navigable waterway that broadly connects two larger bodies of water.
items.explanation: The Strait of Gibraltar connects the Atlantic Ocean to the Mediterranean Sea.

items.q: Which two European countries share the Iberian Peninsula?
items.explanation: They occupy almost the entirety of this peninsula in southwestern Europe.

items.q: What is the capital city of Japan?
items.explanation: The Greater Tokyo Area is the most populous metropolitan area in the world.
